subject: Television
lead_paragraph: The announcer Joe Buck will host a new HBO show starting in May, helping to fill the void left by Bob Costas, who joined the new MLB Network on Tuesday. Buck, who has covered two Super Bowls and 10 World Series, called it a “dream” job. He will keep his play-by-play duties for Fox, where he has covered baseball and the N.F.L. The 90-minute show may involve a studio audience, HBO said, and will not impose on his play-by-play schedule.
